page.title: 03Leisure,Sellindge 1952-85
page.content: Spare time in our village was spent at brownies,guides and youth club,which was run by the village post-man Mr Smith.Some children played down the Brook or climbing trees.Instead of a Village Hall there was a "Red Triangle Hut" where village "hops" were held. These were dances at which dance bands played.There was a local flower show held annually on the corner of Swan Lane and A20 main road.A sports day was held there as well.For adults there were the W.I.,cricket and football clubs and Womens Legion, gardeners and young wives.Mrs Corner and Mrs Crouch said they preferred the village in the 1950's because it was more of a community than it seems in 1985.
